notes: Sixth generation 997.2 facelift with direct fuel injection (DFI). PDK dual-clutch transmission introduced. RWD or AWD (Carrera 4). Targa variant features retractable glass roof panel. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (997) article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation 997.2 Turbo with variable turbine geometry (VTG) turbochargers. AWD standard. Turbo S variant produces 530 hp. Complex boost control requires specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (997) article, January 2025 revision.

Track-focused 997.2 GT3 with naturally aspirated flat-6. Manual transmission only. RWD with race-derived suspension geometry requiring specialized alignment. Large rear wing for downforce. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (997) article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation 991 introduced in 2012. 991.1 (2012-2015) naturally aspirated, 991.2 (2016-2019) twin-turbocharged across all variants. RWD or AWD (Carrera 4). Targa features unique retractable glass roof. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (991) article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation 991 Turbo PDK-only with AWD. Variable turbine geometry turbochargers. Turbo S variant produces 580 hp. Active aerodynamics with deployable rear spoiler. Complex boost control requires specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (991) article, January 2025 revision.

Track-focused 991 GT3 with naturally aspirated 3.8L or 4.0L (GT3 RS) flat-6. Manual available from 2017. RWD with race-derived suspension. Large rear wing. GT3 RS variant produces 500-520 hp. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (991) article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation 987.2 Boxster facelift with direct injection. Mid-engine RWD roadster. PDK dual-clutch transmission introduced. Convertible soft top mechanism requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Boxster article, January 2025 revision.

First generation 987.2 Cayman facelift with direct injection. Mid-engine RWD coupe. PDK dual-clutch transmission introduced. Shares platform with 987 Boxster. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayman article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation 981 Boxster with new platform and styling. Mid-engine RWD. GTS variant added with 3.4L (330 hp). Convertible soft top mechanism requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Boxster article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation 981 Cayman with new platform matching 981 Boxster. Mid-engine RWD. GTS variant with 3.4L (340 hp). GT4 added 2015 with 3.8L (385 hp). Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayman article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation rebranded as 718 Boxster with turbocharged 4-cylinder engines. Mid-engine RWD. Convertible soft top mechanism requires specialized service. Turbocharger boost diagnostics needed. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Boxster article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation rebranded as 718 Cayman with turbocharged 4-cylinder engines. Mid-engine RWD. GTS variant added 2018. GT4 variant retains naturally aspirated 6-cylinder. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayman article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 3.0L supercharged V6 + electric motor S E-Hybrid (416 hp)
notes: Second generation E2 Cayenne (2011-2018). S E-Hybrid PHEV introduced 2015 with 10.8 kWh battery, requires high-voltage expertise. Diesel offered but withdrawn from US market 2016. Turbo S variant produces 570 hp. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayenne article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 3.0L turbo V6 + electric motor E-Hybrid (455-462 hp)
notes: Third generation E3 Cayenne introduced 2018. E-Hybrid PHEV features 14.1 kWh battery with 3.0L V6 and electric motor, requires high-voltage system expertise. Turbocharged engines across all variants. AWD with Porsche Traction Management. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayenne article, January 2025 revision.

First generation 95B Macan compact SUV on VW Group MLB platform. PDK dual-clutch transmission, AWD standard. Turbo variant with twin-turbo 3.6L V6. GTS variant added 2016 with 360 hp. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Macan article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 3.0L supercharged V6 + electric motor S E-Hybrid (416 hp)
notes: First generation G1 Panamera luxury sedan (2010-2016). S E-Hybrid PHEV introduced 2013 with 9.4 kWh battery, requires high-voltage expertise. Turbo S variant produces 550 hp. PDK or Tiptronic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Panamera article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 3.0L supercharged V6 + electric motor S E-Hybrid (416 hp)
notes: First generation G1 Panamera facelift with updated styling and powertrains. S E-Hybrid PHEV with 9.4 kWh battery. Turbo S Executive variant produces 570 hp. All models PDK dual-clutch. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Panamera article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 2.9L twin-turbo V6 + electric motor 4 E-Hybrid (462 hp)
4.0L twin-turbo V8 + electric motor Turbo S E-Hybrid (680 hp)
notes: Second generation G2 Panamera with completely redesigned platform. Two E-Hybrid PHEV variants with 14.1 kWh battery, require high-voltage expertise. Sport Turismo wagon added 2018. Turbo S E-Hybrid most powerful (680 hp). Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Panamera article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 4.6L naturally aspirated V8 + 2 electric motors (887 hp combined)
notes: Limited production plug-in hybrid hypercar. 4.6L V8 (608 hp) with two electric motors (front 129 hp, rear 154 hp), 6.8 kWh lithium-ion battery. Mid-engine with electric front axle for AWD. 918 units produced. Complex hybrid system requires specialized diagnostic equipment and training. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 918 Spyder article, January 2025 revision.
